summary: Interinstitutional relations within the European Union (EU) refer to the intricate legal and regulatory frameworks governing interactions among its key institutions, including the European Commission, European Parliament, and Council of the European Union. These relations are essential for ensuring coherent policy-making, legislative processes, and the implementation of EU laws. They facilitate collaboration and negotiation, enabling institutions to balance their distinct roles while pursuing common objectives. Effective interinstitutional relations are crucial for maintaining the rule of law and democratic accountability within the EU, fostering transparency and mutual respect among institutions in the complex political landscape of European governance.
